section.title: What will your module do?
section.para: It is known to everybody, but often forgotten: a good planning will help you create things better. The first stage in creating your module is the decision and description what your module will do. What is the reason you will create this module? It is clear by now you cannot do it with other tools, so what are the exact needs for this module?
The example module has a clear architecture and reason: it is a demonstration module for developers. It's purpose is clear, and because it is an example, its structure is clear as well.
You module should have the same clear setup.

section.title: Research your module needs
section.para: The module needs are those parts of the system you will need in your module, and the parts that you don't have yet, so will need to create.

The example module needs to show how things work. Therefore, we need the complete directory structure to display, we need an example of data storage, we need example functions to show how data is stored and retreived, we need display functions.. gosh, we need a lot.

section.title: Choose a name
section.para: Choosing a name for your module is important, as this is the main way that your module will be known throughout the Xaraya community. The name should relate to the functionality that the module provides, but also be specific enough to be able to discern it from separate modules that might offer similar functionality. All modules names are lower-case only.

The example module has the straight forward name 'example'. This is a great name, it describes its purpose, it is short enough, easy to remember and easy to write. Compare to a module called "mygreatmodulethatonlyisforme"... and imagine the URL this will generate.

Try to stay within 10 characters for the name. There are two versions of the name for your module: the technical one, all lowercase and used by the Xaraya core to know where to find its API, and a nice one you can use for Display. The display name can have capitals and is mainly used when distributing your module.
You can offer site admins the possibility to use an alias for your module. The alias will be used then instead of the module name.

section.title: Decide on the type of module
Register your module
section.para: Registering your module is not compulsory, but it is a very good idea. By registering your module, you can ensure that no other official Xaraya module will take the name that you have chosen for your module. Two modules with the same name will not operate correctly on a single Xaraya site, so it is beneficial to both yourself and the Xaraya community in general to have a unique name. You may register your module via the release module on http://www.xaraya.com/

section.title: Releasing your module
section.para: If you have registered you module/extension, and if you want to release a version, then you can use the Xaraya Release module. This way, your release will be announced to all Xaraya installs. The Release module will place an announcement on the xaraya.com frontpage and make an accouncement in the RSS feed.
You will have to think of some things before releasing:
